intro: Senecio huitrinicus, commonly known as the Huitrín Cineraria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The bright yellow flowers appear in the summer, adding a striking visual contrast to its green leaves.
